com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.server

Interface ServerConnection


  • public interface ServerConnection
    The ServerConnection is an established connection between the AcrolinxClient and the ServerEndpoint. It requires a User privileged to access the Acrolinx Server. You should use one ServerConnection for your complete session, it is not necessary to create a connection per check.
    Remember to call disconnect() when you are done with all interaction with the Acrolinx Server.
    If you are using a client signature that is licensed with monthly throughput limit on the server (volume license), the given user on server-side is replaced with a special API volume user.
    • If you want to check use getCheckAdapter().
    • If you want to manage user settings use getUserAdapter().
    • If you want to check the user privileges use getPrivileges().
    • If you want to receive the broadcast messages use getBroadcastMessages().
    • If you need the ClientProperties you have to get the ServerEndpoint.getClientProperties() via getServerEndpoint().

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ServerConnection NULL
      The NULL object for ServerConnection.

    • Field Detail

      • NULL

        static final ServerConnection NULL
        The NULL object for ServerConnection. No real connection will be established.

    • Method Detail

      • getServerEndpoint

        ServerEndpoint getServerEndpoint()
        Returns:
        The ServerEndpoint containing all non-session-related methods.

      • getConnectionSettings

        ConnectionSettings getConnectionSettings()
        Returns:
        The complete settings to establish a similar ServerConnection.

      • getPrivileges

        Privileges getPrivileges()
        Returns:
        The Privileges for the User of this ServerConnection.

      • getCheckAdapter

        CheckAdapter getCheckAdapter()
        Returns:
        The CheckAdapter to receive server capabilities and to check a Document

      • getTerminologyAdapter

        TerminologyAdapter getTerminologyAdapter()
        Returns:
        The TerminologyAdapter to manage server terminology.

      • getUserAdapter

        UserAdapter getUserAdapter()
        Returns:
        The UserAdapter is used to manage user properties.

      • getBroadcastMessages

        List<BroadcastMessage> getBroadcastMessages()
                                            throws AuthorizationFailedException
        Note: The Java SDK will store the time of last message request in ApplicationStore. Only new BroadcastMessages and BroadcastMessage of BroadcastMessage.Importance.HIGH will be received.
        Returns:
        A list of new messages.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationFailedException

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        To release the sessions, it is important to call this method when you are done with all of your checks or closing the application. See ServerConnection. If you forget to call disconnect(), your session will stay open until it times out on the server. This can cause the licensing exception "Your license is already in use" when you connect again to the server with the same user.
